Forward Marginal Effects (FMEs) are problably one of the most intuitive ways to interpret feature effects in supervised machine learning models. They are model-agnostic and can be applied to arbitrary regression and (binary) classification models. In some way, they emulate beta coefficients of a linear regression model.
